item.server_side_rocketry.guidebook: Guide to Rocket Science and Space Exploration
server_side_rocketry.celestial.earth.des: The most habitable planet in the Solar System.
server_side_rocketry.celestial.mercury.d: Extremely hot due to its proximity to the Sun.
server_side_rocketry.celestial.venus.des: Its conditions are so intense that nothing can survive.
server_side_rocketry.celestial.mars.desc: Gains its red color from iron oxide.
server_side_rocketry.guidebook.page1.tit: [#1] Guide to Rocket Science and Space Exploration
server_side_rocketry.guidebook.page1.con: This guide will show you how to get to space safely. Use the Previous and Next Page buttons to navigate. Note: On pages with crafting recipes, you may need to check your recipe book. If the recipes aren't showing up, press Unlock Recipes in Book on the page.
server_side_rocketry.guidebook.page2.con: Space suits are necessary to survive in space. You need a space helmet to breathe oxygen from canisters, and the other parts of the space suit protect you from harsh climates. Space suits can be crafted with basic materials; check the recipe book for more info.
server_side_rocketry.guidebook.page3.con: On other planets and moons, you need oxygen canisters to survive. Fill oxygen canisters on planets with oxygen and bring them with you to space. You can use oxygen compressors to fill canisters.
server_side_rocketry.guidebook.page4.con: Rockets allow you to reach destinations in space. After crafting one, you can select a destination and ride the rocket until you're there. Be sure you have a space suit and sufficient oxygen before takeoff!
server_side_rocketry.guidebook.page5.con: Once you have established bases across the Solar System, you may want to set up item transport between them. Cargo rockets can autonomously travel between planets and moons. Power a Cargo Launch Controller near a configured one to launch it. It will land at the same coordinate that it took off from. There are also various other machines you can craft to interact with Cargo Rockets.
server_side_rocketry.guidebook.page6.con: Mercury is the second-hottest planet in the Solar System. You'll need a space suit enchanted with Insulation to survive there.
server_side_rocketry.guidebook.page7.con: Venus is the hottest planet in the Solar System. It also has a thick atmosphere, so you'll need both Insulation and Pressure Protection on your space suit to survive.
server_side_rocketry.guidebook.page8.con: The Moon is the Earth's only moon. It's a good starting point for space missions.
server_side_rocketry.guidebook.page9.con: Mars is covered in iron oxide dust, making it red. It's very cold, but not cold enough to require any more than a standard space suit.
